title: 53 of the Environmental Protection Agency Act 1992 (No. 7 of 1992) and for
heading: In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations – 

"1992 Act” means the Environmental Protection Agency Act 1992 (No. 7 of 
1992); 

“Agency” means the Environmental Protection Agency established under 
section 19 of the Environmental Protection Agency Act 1992 (No. 7 of 1992); 

“installation” means, a stationary technical unit where one or more activities 
listed in Schedule 1 of the 1992 Act may be carried out and any other directly 
associated activities which have a technical connection with the said activities 
on that site and which could have an effect on emissions and pollution, and 
references to an installation include references to part of an installation; 

“emissions” means the release of greenhouse gases from sources in an 
installation. 

“EU ETS Regulations” means, the European Communities (Greenhouse Gas 
Emissions Trading) Regulations 2024.

title: 53 of the Environmental Protection Agency Act 1992 (No. 7 of 1992) and for
heading: 3. These Regulations provide for the interaction of Agency's integrated
text_raw:
3. These Regulations provide for the interaction of Agency's integrated 
pollution prevention and control licensing functions with the EU ETS 
Regulations 

Co-ordination with Integrated Pollution Control Licensing

title: 53 of the Environmental Protection Agency Act 1992 (No. 7 of 1992) and for
heading: 4. (1) The Agency shall ensure that where installations carry out activities
text_raw:
4. (1) The Agency shall ensure that where installations carry out activities 
that are included in Schedule 1 to the 1992 Act, the conditions of, and procedure 
for, the issue of a greenhouse gas emissions permit under the EU ETS 
Regulations are co-ordinated with those for licences issued under Part IV of the 
1992 Act. 

(2) The Agency may integrate the requirements of Regulations 6, 7 and 8 of 
the EU ETS Regulations into the procedures for licences issued under Part IV of 
the 1992 Act. 

Amendment of Procedures for Integrated Pollution Control Licensing

title: 53 of the Environmental Protection Agency Act 1992 (No. 7 of 1992) and for
heading: 5. (1) The 1992 Act shall apply to installations under these Regulations with
text_raw:
5. (1) The 1992 Act shall apply to installations under these Regulations with 
the following modifications and with any other necessary modifications to that 
Act arising from the implementation of the EU ETS Regulations, and references 
in that Act or to the provisions of that Act shall, unless the context otherwise 
requires, be construed as including references to the EU ETS Regulations or the 
provisions of these Regulations. 

(2) The Agency in issuing a licence pursuant to Part IV of the 1992 Act– 

(a) 

shall not have regard 
to sections 83(4)(a), 83(5)(a)(vi), 
86(1)(a)(i), 86(1)(b)(i), 86A(2), 86A(3)(b), 86A(3)(c)(ii) and 
(c)(iii) (in so far as it applies to emission limit values), 86A(4), 
86A(5), 86A(6), 90(4)(a)(i) and 90(4)(a)(iia) of that Act in respect 
of greenhouse gas emissions, unless it is necessary to ensure that 
no significant local pollution is caused, 

(b) may choose not to impose the requirements of Sections 
83(5)(a)(viii), 86(1)(b)(vii) and 86(1)(b)(ix) in respect of 
greenhouse gas emissions and may amend any licence issued as 
appropriate. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 
19 September, 2024. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for the Environment, 
Climate and Communications.
